thread.title: 5 fun things to do this weekend
thread.title_full: 5 fun things to do this weekend

author: Monica Magalhaes
title: 5 fun things to do this weekend
text:
Previous Next 
Boo At The Zoo at the Palm Beach Zoo - Friday, October 23, 2015, 10 a.m. – 9 p.m. at 1301 Summit Blvd West Palm Beach, FL 33405 
Grab your ghosts and ghoulies and head to the wildest Halloween celebration in Palm Beach County! Now in its 17th year, Boo at the Zoo offers a safe and fun environment for children of all ages to trick-or-treat. 
Additional activities include: costume contests, dance parties, games, crafts, pumpkin patch, bounce house, hay stack hunt, face painting, character meet 'n' greets, local vendors, giveaways, wildlife shows and presentations, roaming animal encounters, and much more! 
For more information, click here . 
Jacoby Brothers Band - BLUES - Friday, October 23, 2015, 8 – 10 p.m. at the Arts Garage - 180 NE 1st Street Delray Beach, FL 33444 
The Jacoby Brothers Band, comprised of brothers Edwin and Mark Jacoby, have been entertaining audiences with the soulful sounds of the blues for decades. Their extensive repertoire includes tunes that most anyone will recognize and enjoy, performed with extensive musicianship and charisma. PRE-SHOW: check out some awesome artwork at the FREE Artist/Blues Series: Gallery Reception and Exhi-bition, featuring singer Edwin Jacoby’s artwork, 6 p.m.-8 p.m. For more information, click here . 
Yo Ho Ho Matey! Saturday, Oct 24 – All day - Downtown Boynton Beach - Federal Highway and Ocean Avenue Boynton Beach, FL 33435. 
The Boynton Beach Community Redevelopment Agency (CRA) proudly announces the 4th Annual Haunted Pirate Fest & Mermaid Splash on Saturday, October 24th and Sunday, October 25th in downtown Boynton Beach. This Free two-day fest will be located along E. Ocean Avenue between Seacrest Blvd. and Federal Highway from 11am -9pm Saturday and 11am-7pm Sunday. During Pirate Fest, East Ocean Avenue will be transformed into Hobb’s Cove, a bustling old world port brimming with pirate superstitions of the ship wrecks off the coast of Boynton Beach and Forbidden Island, a mysterious oasis where the sirens of the sea lure you into the depths with their song. 
This lively event features 11 stages of continuous live music, children’s activities, pirate stunt shows, the Enchanted & Thieves Market and Grub & Grog Row. 
The event will also feature a Spooktacular Haunted House presented by the Schoolhouse Children's Museum. The CRA invites everyone to participate in the “pirate/mermaid nostalgic maritime” theme and come in costume to celebrate Boynton’s signature event! 
For more information, click here . 
BOOtanical Halloween - Saturday, October 24, 2015, 2 – 3:30 p.m. at the Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens - 2410 SE Westmoreland Blvd., Port St. Lucie, FL 34952 
Bring the family for an afternoon of Halloween fun. It's that time again kids...put on your costume, come to The Gardens, and join in the Halloween fun. treats, games, races, crafts, music and more! Free to children and their families. Please call 772-337-1959 to register. 
For more information, click here . 
Northwood Village Farmer's Market - Sunday, October 25, 2015, 10 a.m. – 2 p.m. at Northwood Rd. West Palm Beach. 
Over 20 local vendors with offerings from honey to fresh produce as well as arts and crafts every Sunday in Historic Northwood Village. Visitors can expect live entertainment each week from different performers as well as food service from a variety of restaurants and food trucks. 
For more information, click here .
